Key to the families of Dicotyledons
Key to the genera of Asteraceae

source.author: Jeanes, J.A.
source.title: Asteraceae
source.in_title: Flora of Victoria. Vol. 4. Cornaceae to Asteraceae
source.citation: From: Jeanes, J.A. (1999). Asteraceae. In: Walsh, N.G.; Entwisle, T.J. (eds), Flora of Victoria. Vol. 4. Cornaceae to Asteraceae. Inkata Press, Melbourne.

leads.lead_text: Leaves thin-textured, usually dull, often glaucous; cauline leaves with acute auricles; cypselas moderately compressed with narrow margins, 3-ribbed on each face and transversely wrinkled all over
Leaves rather thick, glossy; cauline leaves with rounded auricles; cypselas much-compressed, winged, 3-ribbed on each face but not wrinkled
Leaf-margins spinose; basal leaves deeply pinnatifid to pinnatisect; cypselas usually 2–3 mm long; widespread annual or biennial
Leaf-margins toothed but not spinose; basal leaves sinuate-pinnatifid; cypselas usually 3–4 mm long; annual, biennial or perennial
